channel.title: Comments for page "Pack Hunters of the Silicon Savannas"

item.title: Algorithms Already Cooperating
item.content:encoded: It would be hard to tell if the network of interacting high frequency trading algorithms on Wall Street where competing or cooperating with similar clusters of algorithms running on server farms at competing banks or consulting firms and hedge funds. They might even be colluding with airline price-setting algorithms to ensure their forecasts for airline profitability and stock appreciation are realized. They might one day "conspire" to cause an airline crash in order to profit on the futures contracts they are trading. After all their only "design" is the selective pressure of natural selection (human selection) for profitability.
